source.name: Measure 20 : Percentage of People with High Blood Pressure that is Controlled | Age Group
source.description:
Inclusion Criteria: All non-pregnant survey participants ages 18+ years with non-zero blood pressure measurements.
Exclusion Criteria: Pregnant women. Blood pressure measurements were not obtained in survey participants less than age 8 years and use of anti-hypertensive medication questionnaire not asked of survey participants less than age 16 years. Insufficient sample size of controlled blood pressure for ages 16-17 years, therefore this age range not included.

The red lines in the chart below indicate the confidence interval. The lower and upper confidence interval values can be seen in the table view. For more information on confidence intervals, please see the Glossary under Help.
